page.title: 09 NESS HOUSE-A LOCAL BUSINESS
page.content: Ness House was built for Lord Clifford as a holiday residence. He then sold it to Teignmouth (later Teign -bridge) Council in the 1950s. They leased it out and it wasa run as a hotel for over 25 years. Now it is the Ness House Inn and it is no longer run as a hotel because it is not feasable as it only has 8 bed- rooms. It has recently been extended to included a resturant. Upstairs the new owners hope to build a large function room by knocking several rooms into one. They may have difficulties as Ness House is a grade "A" listed building. The new owners acquired the building by auction, paying 155,000 pounds. There is a beer garden at the back and a garden a around the side with tables and a car park. From the gardens there is a good view of the Ness.
